modules.description: This module offers functions for constructing HTML attributes and tags, handling diverse value types such as strings, booleans, integers, and enumerated values, with suffixes like `_` or `to_attr` to resolve naming conflicts between attributes and tags. It supports precise manipulation of elements like form fields, styling properties, and event handlers, while addressing edge cases such as text content preservation in tags like `style` or `script`, and semantic HTML structures. Use cases include generating valid DOM structures, managing conditional attributes, and ensuring type-safe interactions with HTML syntax.

Generates SVG attributes and elements using specific string and enumerated value types. Handles path data, styling properties, and viewport definitions for embedding vector graphics. Constructs SVG elements with defined attributes for use in HTML or graphic rendering pipelines.

The module provides attribute-setting and element-construction operations for mathematical notation, handling XML-like structures to manage styling, layout, and semantic components. It supports specific use cases such as generating square roots, subscripts, tables, and text with precise formatting, spacing, and structural controls. Operations include converting values like booleans and integers into attributes, as well as defining tags for mathematical expressions.

This module defines and manages ARIA attributes to enhance accessibility, focusing on roles, states, and properties for interactive elements using boolean flags, enumerated types, and string-based references. It operates on HTML elements and data types like integers, strings, and enums to convey dynamic information, such as row indices, selection status, and live region updates. Use cases include improving screen reader support for complex UI components like tables and dynamic forms.

Provides functions to create and manipulate XML namespace attributes and link elements. Works with XML attribute and tag data structures. Used to construct valid XML documents with proper namespace declarations and hyperlinks.

The module provides functions for constructing and manipulating RSS 2.0 feed elements, including handling attributes like domain, path, and protocol, as well as tags such as author, description, and channel through structured data types. It also includes operations to extract metadata fields like title, link, and publication date from tagged data structures representing RSS elements. These capabilities support use cases such as generating customized feeds with specific attributes or parsing existing feeds to retrieve key descriptive information.

This module offers functions to configure HTMX behavior through attributes, enabling HTTP method control, event handling, DOM manipulation, and dynamic page updates via client-side AJAX. It works with string and boolean values representing raw HTML attributes, focusing on interactions like WebSocket connections, request parameters, and Hyperscript integration. Use cases include real-time content loading, form submissions without page reloads, and managing client-side state through HTMX's attribute-driven API.

Processes HTML elements by extracting attributes, traversing node trees, and generating serialized output. Operates on nested lists representing DOM nodes and associative arrays for attribute mappings. Used to transform parsed HTML structures into string representations for web rendering.

Combines HTML, SVG, math, ARIA, XML, RSS, and HTMX elements with type-safe attribute handling, supporting diverse value types and structured data for building semantic, accessible, and dynamic web content. It enables creation of form fields, mathematical expressions, vector graphics, accessible UI components, XML namespaces, RSS feeds, and AJAX-enabled interfaces through specialized functions and data types. Operations include setting boolean, integer, and enumerated attributes, embedding raw text in script and style tags, and defining complex structures like tables, paths, and live regions. Examples include generating accessible forms, embedding SVG icons, constructing mathematical equations, and building real-time RSS updates with custom metadata.
